meanings.definition: A thick stick or cudgel typically made of oak or blackthorn wood.
meanings.sent1: He held the shillelah tightly in his hand during the walk in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The old man leaned on his shillelah as he hiked up the hill.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the shillelah as a balance beam in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a shillelah, striking deep into his heart.
meanings.sent5: The shillelah's rough texture reminded him of the ancient forests where it was crafted.

meanings.definition: To strike or beat someone with a shillelah.
meanings.sent1: He threatened to shillelah the door if it didn't open soon.
meanings.sent2: The bully tried to shillelah the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent3: In the play, the comedian pretended to shillelah his co-star with a rubber prop.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to shillelah the trees with its fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: She felt the urge to shillelah the punching bag to release her anger.
